snippet: The lawsuit was filed by relatives of three citizens who died in drone strikes, including the radical Muslim cleric, Anwar al-Awlaki, and has opened a new chapter in the legal wrangling over the use of drones.
abstract: Relatives of Anwar al-Awaki and Samir Kahn, Americans killed in drone strikes in Yemen in 2011, file a wrongful-death lawsuit against Defense Sec Leon E Panetta and three other senior national security officials; the federal suit claims that the United States violated the fundamental rights of Awlaki and Kahn; it opens a new chapter in the legal wrangling over the Obama administration’s use of drones in pursuit of terrorism suspects away from traditional battlefields like Afghanistan.
lead_paragraph: The lawsuit was filed by relatives of three citizens who died in drone strikes, including the radical Muslim cleric, Anwar al-Awlaki, and has opened a new chapter in the legal wrangling over the use of drones.
